The source of the claim: The expert noted that the claim originated from an article published on the website "World News Daily Report" on May 31, 2019. The expert highlighted that this website is known for publishing satirical and fictional content.
Lack of mainstream press coverage: The expert pointed out that the claim did not receive any coverage from mainstream press outlets. This raised suspicions about the authenticity of the story, as significant news events usually garner media attention.
Inconsistencies in the story: The expert mentioned several inconsistencies in the article, such as the misspelling of words and the inclusion of a disclaimer on the website stating that the content is fictional. These inconsistencies further cast doubt on the veracity of the claim.
Unreliable secondary source: The expert noted that the claim was subsequently published on another website called "My Christian Shoppe," which did not carry the same disclaimer as the original source. This raised concerns about the reliability and credibility of the secondary source.
